120 static std::map< chaos::str::UTF8String, UnitTest* > test_map;

133 struct OutInfo
134 {
135  chaos::uint16 verbosity;

138  OutInfo( chaos::uint8 v, TestLogger::OutFormat f )
139  :
140  verbosity( v ),

151 struct RunInfo
152 {
153  // whether the tests should be run in a single process or not
154  bool single_proc;
155  // whether the test is being run as a sub-process of a parent testing
156  // process
157  bool sub_proc;
158  // the paths to the tests to run
159  std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > paths;
160  // whether the standard output stream is being used
161  bool use_stdout;
162  // information for stdout
163  OutInfo stdout_info;
164  // mapping from file path to write to, to the format to use
165  std::map< chaos::str::UTF8String, OutInfo* > files;
166 
167  RunInfo()
168  :
169  single_proc( false ),
170  sub_proc ( false ),
171  use_stdout ( true ),
172  stdout_info( 3, TestLogger::OUT_PRETTY_TEXT )
173  {
174  }
175 };
176 
177 
186 class TestCore
187 {
188 public:
189 
190  static TestLogger logger;
191 
192  // TODO: can we move to inline cpp functions?
193 
202  TestCore(
203  const chaos::str::UTF8String& path,
204  UnitTest* unit_test,
205  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
206  chaos::int32 line,
207  bool module = false,
208  RunInfo* run_info = NULL )
209  {
210  // is this the run key?
211  if ( run_info )
212  {
213  // mark parent logger?
214  if ( !run_info->sub_proc )
215  {
216  TestCore::logger.set_as_parent( true );
217  }
218 
219  // pass outputs to the logger
220  if ( run_info->use_stdout )
221  {
222  TestCore::logger.add_stdout(
223  run_info->stdout_info.verbosity,
224  run_info->stdout_info.format );
225  }
226  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( f_it, run_info->files )
227  {
228  TestCore::logger.add_file_output(
229  f_it->first,
230  f_it->second->verbosity,
231  f_it->second->format
232  );
233  }
234 
235  // open the logger
236  TestCore::logger.open_log();
237 
238  // run the tests
239  TestCore::run( run_info );
240 
241  // close the logger
242  TestCore::logger.close_log();
243 
244  // clean up run info
245  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( r_t_it, run_info->files )
246  {
247  delete r_t_it->second;
248  }
249  // clean up unit test pointers
250  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( t_it, test_map )
251  {
252  delete t_it->second;
253  }
254  return;
255  }
256 
257  // is this a module deceleration?
258  if ( module )
259  {
260  // does the path need checking?
261  if ( path.get_length() > 1 )
262  {
263  // check that first or last symbols are not a periods
264  if ( path.get_symbol( 0 ) == "." ||
265  path.get_symbol( path.get_length() - 1 ) == "." )
266  {
267  chaos::str::UTF8String error_message;
268  error_message << "Invalid test module path: \"" << path
269  << "\". Test paths cannot start or end with "
270  << "\'.\'";
271  TestCore::throw_error( error_message, file, line );
272  }
273  // check that there are not two consecutive periods
274  for ( size_t i = 0; i < path.get_length() - 1; ++i )
275  {
276  if ( path.get_symbol( i ) == "." &&
277  path.get_symbol( i + 1 ) == "." )
278  {
279  chaos::str::UTF8String error_message;
280  error_message << "Invalid test module path: \"" << path
281  << "\". Test paths cannot contain two or "
282  << "more consecutive \'.\'";
283  TestCore::throw_error( error_message, file, line );
284  }
285  }
286  // check any variation of the path exists in the map
287  std::vector< chaos::str::UTF8String > elements =
288  path.split( "." );
289  chaos::str::UTF8String check_path;
290  // add the first element to the base modules
291  base_modules.insert( elements[ 0 ] );
292  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( it, elements )
293  {
294  if ( !check_path.is_empty() )
295  {
296  check_path += ".";
297  }
298  check_path += *it;
299  // add to the list of known modules
300  known_modules.insert( check_path );
301 
302  if ( test_map.find( check_path ) != test_map.end() )
303  {
304  chaos::str::UTF8String error_message;
305  error_message << "Ambiguous test module path: \""
306  << check_path << "\". Unit test already "
307  << "defined with this exact path.";
308  TestCore::throw_error( error_message, file, line );
309  }
310  }
311  }
312 
313  current_module = path;
314  return;
315  }
316 
317  // validate
318  // ensure a module has been declared
319  if ( current_module.is_empty() )
320  {
321  TestCore::throw_error(
322  "CHAOS_TEST_MODULE( <module_name> ) must be declared in "
323  "file before any test decelerations.",
324  file,
325  line
326  );
327  }
328  // ensure the path is not empty
329  if ( path.is_empty() )
330  {
331  TestCore::throw_error(
332  "Unit test declared with no path.",
333  file,
334  line
335  );
336  }
337  // build the full path
338  chaos::str::UTF8String full_path( current_module );
339  full_path += ".";
340  full_path += path;
341  // check that path is not already in the map
342  if ( test_map.find( full_path ) != test_map.end() )
343  {
344  chaos::str::UTF8String error_message;
345  error_message << "Test path: \"" << full_path << "\" has multiple "
346  << "definitions.";
347  TestCore::throw_error( error_message, file, line );
348  }
349  // check that the full path doesn't match any known modules
350  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( it, known_modules )
351  {
352  if ( full_path == *it )
353  {
354  chaos::str::UTF8String error_message;
355  error_message << "Ambiguous test path: \"" << full_path
356  << "\". Test module already defined with this "
357  << "exact path.";
358  TestCore::throw_error( error_message, file, line );
359  }
360  }
361  // pass the test unit into the global mapping
362  test_map[ full_path ] = unit_test;
363  }
364 
370  static void run( RunInfo* run_info )
371  {
372  // have any paths been supplied?
373  if ( run_info->paths.empty() )
374  {
375  // run this function again with each of the base modules
376  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( it, base_modules )
377  {
378  RunInfo base_run_info( *run_info );
379  base_run_info.paths.insert( *it );
380  TestCore::run( &base_run_info );
381  }
382  return;
383  }
384 
385  // sanitize the provided paths
386  std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > paths;
387  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( p_it, run_info->paths )
388  {
389  // check if the path is even valid
390  bool match = false;
391  // is the path a non-module
392  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( mIt, known_modules )
393  {
394  if ( *p_it == *mIt )
395  {
396  // this path is a known module
397  match = true;
398  break;
399  }
400  }
401  // not a module, is it an exact path?
402  if ( !match )
403  {
404  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( u_p_it, test_map )
405  {
406  if ( *p_it == u_p_it->first )
407  {
408  // this path is an exact test
409  match = true;
410  break;
411  }
412  }
413  }
414  // this isn't a valid test path
415  if ( !match )
416  {
417  // TODO: throw exception? or...
418  // TODO: write to log or output
419  std::cout << "Invalid test path!" << std::endl;
420  continue;
421  }
422 
423  // check if this tests starts with any of the other paths
424  bool is_sub_path = false;
425  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( p_it2, run_info->paths )
426  {
427  // this is the same path
428  if ( *p_it == *p_it2 )
429  {
430  continue;
431  }
432  // is this a sub-path?
433  if ( p_it->starts_with( *p_it2 ) )
434  {
435  is_sub_path = false;
436  break;
437  }
438  }
439  // if this is not a sub-path then we shall use it
440  if ( !is_sub_path )
441  {
442  paths.insert( *p_it );
443  }
444  }
445 
446  // TODO: no valid paths?
447 
448  // structure for grouping tests by path
449  struct PathGroup
450  {
451  chaos::str::UTF8String path;
452  std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > test_paths;
453  std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > module_paths;
454  };
455  std::vector< PathGroup > path_groups;
456 
457  // run logic for each supplied path
458  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( it, paths )
459  {
460  // create a group for the path
461  PathGroup path_group;
462  path_group.path = *it;
463 
464  // find tests that are directly under this module or match this
465  // exact module
466  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( mIt, test_map )
467  {
468  // is there an exact match?
469  if ( mIt->first == *it )
470  {
471  path_group.test_paths.insert( mIt->first );
472  continue;
473  }
474  // extract the path to the test
475  chaos::str::UTF8String path = mIt->first;
476  // find the last period
477  size_t lastIndex = path.find_last( "." );
478  if ( lastIndex == chaos::str::UTF8String::npos )
479  {
480  throw chaos::test::ex::TestRuntimeError(
481  "Unexpected error 67" );
482  }
483  // get the base path
484  path = path.substring( 0 , lastIndex );
485  // does it match the current path
486  if ( path == *it )
487  {
488  path_group.test_paths.insert( mIt->first );
489  }
490  }
491 
492  // find other modules that are directly under this path
493  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( mdIt, known_modules )
494  {
495  // ignore exact match
496  if ( *mdIt == *it )
497  {
498  continue;
499  }
500  // extract the path to the module
501  chaos::str::UTF8String path = *mdIt;
502  // find the last period
503  size_t lastIndex = path.find_last( "." );
504  if ( lastIndex == chaos::str::UTF8String::npos )
505  {
506  continue;
507  }
508  // get the base path
509  path = path.substring( 0 , lastIndex );
510  // does it match the current path
511  if ( path == *it )
512  {
513  path_group.module_paths.insert( *mdIt );
514  }
515  }
516 
517  // record the path group
518  path_groups.push_back( path_group );
519  }
520 
521  // run each of the path groups
522  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( p_g_it, path_groups )
523  {
524  // run any of single tests we have
525  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( t_p_it, p_g_it->test_paths )
526  {
527  TestCore::run_test( test_map[ *t_p_it ], run_info );
528  }
529  // run any of the sub modules
530  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( m_p_it, p_g_it->module_paths )
531  {
532  // build new run info
533  RunInfo module_run_info( *run_info );
534  module_run_info.paths.clear();
535  module_run_info.paths.insert( *m_p_it );
536  TestCore::run( &module_run_info );
537  }
538  }
539  }
540 
546  static void run_test( UnitTest* unit_test, RunInfo* run_info )
547  {
548  // run the test dependent on the mode
549  if ( run_info->single_proc )
550  {
551  if ( run_info->sub_proc )
552  {
553  run_current_proc_no_open( unit_test );
554  }
555  else
556  {
557  run_current_proc( unit_test, run_info );
558  }
559  }
560  else
561  {
562  run_new_proc( unit_test, run_info );
563  }
564  }
565 
571  static void run_current_proc( UnitTest* unit_test, RunInfo* run_info )
572  {
573  // the path to this test
574  chaos::str::UTF8String test_path( *run_info->paths.begin() );
575  // generate an unique id for this test
576  chaos::str::UTF8String id = generate_id( test_path );
577  // open the test in logger
578  TestCore::logger.open_test( test_path, id );
579  // set up fixture
580  unit_test->get_fixture()->setup();
581  // execute
582  unit_test->execute();
583  // teardown
584  unit_test->get_fixture()->teardown();
585  // finialise report
586  TestCore::logger.finialise_test_report();
587  // close the test in logger
588  TestCore::logger.close_test( id );
589  }
590 
596  static void run_current_proc_no_open( UnitTest* unit_test )
597  {
598  // set up fixture
599  unit_test->get_fixture()->setup();
600  // execute
601  unit_test->execute();
602  // teardown
603  unit_test->get_fixture()->teardown();
604  // finialise report
605  TestCore::logger.finialise_test_report();
606  }
607 
613  static void run_new_proc( UnitTest* unit_test, RunInfo* run_info )
614  {
615  // The method spawning a new process is platform dependent
616  #ifdef CHAOS_OS_UNIX
617 
618  // the path to this test
619  chaos::str::UTF8String test_path( *run_info->paths.begin() );
620  // generate the unique id for this this test
621  chaos::str::UTF8String id = generate_id( test_path );
622  // open the test in the logger
623  TestCore::logger.open_test( test_path, id );
624 
625  // for to run the new process
626  pid_t proc_id = fork();
627  if ( proc_id == 0 )
628  {
629  // we are now on a new process so just use the single proc
630  // function.
631  TestCore::run_current_proc_no_open( unit_test );
632  exit( 0 );
633  }
634  else
635  {
636  // wait for the child process to end
637  int proc_status;
638  waitpid( proc_id, &proc_status, 0 );
639  // TODO: check child status and log error message
640 
641  // close the test in the logger
642  TestCore::logger.close_test( id );
643  }
644 
645  #elif defined( CHAOS_OS_WINDOWS )
646 
647  // the path to this test
648  chaos::str::UTF8String test_path( *run_info->paths.begin() );
649  // generate the unique id for this this test
650  chaos::str::UTF8String id = generate_id( test_path );
651 
652  // rebuild the command line arguments
653  chaos::str::UTF8String command_line_args;
654  command_line_args << " --single_proc --sub_proc --silent_crash "
655  << " --test " << test_path;
656  // std out
657  if ( run_info->use_stdout )
658  {
659  command_line_args
660  << " --stdout "
661  << run_info->stdout_info.verbosity << " "
662  << log_format_to_string( run_info->stdout_info.format );
663  }
664  // file outputs
665  CHAOS_FOR_EACH( f_it, run_info->files )
666  {
667  // generate a mangled file path
668  command_line_args
669  << " --fileout " << f_it->first << "." << id << " "
670  << f_it->second->verbosity << " "
671  << log_format_to_string( f_it->second->format );
672  }
673 
674  // spawn a new instance of this process but with arguments to point
675  // to a single test case
676  STARTUPINFO startup_info;
677  PROCESS_INFORMATION proc_info;
678  ZeroMemory( &startup_info, sizeof( startup_info ) );
679  startup_info.cb = sizeof( startup_info );
680  startup_info.hStdError = FALSE;
681  ZeroMemory( &proc_info, sizeof( proc_info ) );
682 
683  // get the path to this executable
684  TCHAR exe_path[ MAX_PATH ];
685  GetModuleFileName( NULL, exe_path, MAX_PATH );
686 
687  // open the test in the logger
688  TestCore::logger.open_test( test_path, id );
689 
690  // start the child process
691  BOOL create_success = CreateProcess(
692  exe_path,
693  const_cast< LPSTR >( command_line_args.get_cstring() ),
694  NULL,
695  NULL,
696  FALSE,
697  0,
698  NULL,
699  NULL,
700  &startup_info,
701  &proc_info
702  );
703 
704  // was there an error?
705  if ( !create_success )
706  {
707  // get the error code
708  DWORD last_error = GetLastError();
709  TCHAR win_error_message[ 512 ];
710  FormatMessage(
711  FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM,
712  NULL,
713  last_error,
714  MAKELANGID( LANG_NEUTRAL, SUBLANG_DEFAULT ),
715  win_error_message,
716  511,
717  NULL
718  );
719  chaos::str::UTF8String error_message;
720  error_message << "Spawning separate test process using "
721  << "CreateProcess (Windows) has failed with the "
722  << "error message: " << win_error_message;
723  throw chaos::test::ex::TestRuntimeError( error_message );
724  }
725 
726  // wait until the child process has finished
727  WaitForSingleObject( proc_info.hProcess, INFINITE );
728  // close process and thread handles
729  CloseHandle( proc_info.hProcess );
730  CloseHandle( proc_info.hThread );
731 
732  // TODO: check child process and log error message
733 
734  // close the test in the logger
735  TestCore::logger.close_test( id );
736 
737  #else
738 
739  // TODO: spawn new single_proc process
740  // TODO: update error to know Windows and Unix
741  throw chaos::test::ex::TestRuntimeError(
742  "Running tests on new processes is not yet supported for "
743  "non-UNIX non-Windows platforms."
744  );
745 
746  #endif
747  }
748 
752  static chaos::str::UTF8String generate_id(
753  const chaos::str::UTF8String& name )
754  {
755  chaos::str::UTF8String id = name;
756  id << "_" << chaos::time::get_current_time();
757  return id;
758  }
759 
766  static chaos::str::UTF8String log_format_to_string(
767  TestLogger::OutFormat format )
768  {
769  switch( format )
770  {
771  case TestLogger::OUT_PLAIN_TEXT:
772  {
773  return "plain";
774  }
775  case TestLogger::OUT_PRETTY_TEXT:
776  {
777  return "pretty";
778  }
779  case TestLogger::OUT_XML:
780  {
781  return "xml";
782  }
783  case TestLogger::OUT_HTML:
784  {
785  return "html";
786  }
787  }
788 
789  return "";
790  }
791 
799  static void register_success(
800  const chaos::str::UTF8String& type,
801  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
802  int line )
803  {
804  // TODO: count success and total
805 
806  // send to logger
807  TestCore::logger.report_success( type, file, line );
808  }
809 
818  static void register_failure(
819  const chaos::str::UTF8String& type,
820  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
821  int line,
822  const chaos::str::UTF8String& message )
823  {
824  // TODO: count failures and total
825 
826  // send to logger
827  TestCore::logger.report_failure( type, file, line, message );
828  }
829 
835  static void throw_error(
836  const chaos::str::UTF8String& message,
837  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
838  chaos::int32 line )
839  {
840  // convert line to string
841  std::stringstream lineStr;
842  // TODO: need operator to do this with UTF8String
843  lineStr << line;
844 
845  //format the error message.
846  chaos::str::UTF8String error_message;
847  error_message << "\n\n\t" << message << "\n\n\tFILE: " << file
848  << "\n\tLINE: " << line << "\n";
849  throw chaos::test::ex::TestDeclerationError( error_message );
850  }
851 };

870 #define CHAOS_TEST_MODULE( path ) \
871  namespace \
872  { \
873  chaos::test::internal::TestCore t( #path, NULL, "", 0, true ); \
874  }
875 
881 #define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT( path ) \
882  CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( path, chaos::test::Fixture )
883 
889 #define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( path, fixture_type ) \
890  struct path : public chaos::test::internal::UnitTest \
891  { \
892  fixture_type* fixture; \
893  path() : UnitTest( #path ), fixture( new fixture_type() ){} \
894  virtual ~path(){ delete fixture; } \
895  virtual chaos::test::Fixture* get_fixture() { return fixture; } \
896  virtual void execute(); \
897  }; \
898  static chaos::test::internal::TestCore object_##path ( \
899  #path, new path(), __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
900  void path::execute()

904 
905  #define CHAOS_TEST_EQUAL( a, b ) \
906  if ( a == b ) \
907  { \
908  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::register_success( \
909  "TEST_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
910  } \
911  else \
912  { \
913  chaos::str::UTF8String f_e_m; \
914  f_e_m << a << " does not equal " << b; \
915  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::register_failure( \
916  "TEST_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
917  }
918 
919 } // namespace test
920 } // namespace chaos
921 
922 #endif
923 
924 // reset the current module
925 namespace chaos_test_include
926 {
927 static chaos::test::internal::TestCore reset( "", NULL, "", 0, true );
928 }
